column5: I have about 1100 lbs of stuff sitting on the front porch, awaiting Brian who gets to drive AND pick the music on our drive to Opeongo.  We will be four, then six,  then eight and back to six, frolickers over the course of the week, with Brian and I coming home on Thursday.  Lake trout will be on the plate at least once during our stay on the north arm, and Eric's Island and Frank's ashes will be honoured again.  Play nice now, and there will be a report on Friday or so.
Have a  great time douG, I'll look forward to your report.  Maureen
Have fun & don't catch 'em all!  Here's a lil' beaver to take with ya..
The Best of Luck to all y'all!!!
good luck and have a great trip
Best of luck.  Algonquin park is such a beautiful place.  I imagine is freaking cold there at this time.  Stay safe and have fun.
Good luck to ya douG, I'll be waiting for the report!
Missed your send off Dougal...but I know you'll have a great time... you always do.
Have a good trip. I'll only be a few lakes away come Tuesday.  -R-
